state.unicode: Other nation's attitudes towards selected nation

uientry.s:
local this = UIComponent(Address) local scroll = UIComponent(this:Parent("diplomatic_relations"))
function OnLClickUp() scroll:LuaCall("ToggleAttitude") end

local this = UIComponent(Address) local scroll = UIComponent(this:Parent("diplomatic_relations"))
function OnLClickUp() scroll:LuaCall("ToggleAttitude") end

uientry.unicode: Diplomatic relations map.||You can choose between two views: Other nation's attitudes towards selected nation, and selected nation's attitude towards others.||The regions are coloured according to this context. Green means friendly and red is unfriendly.||This is useful to see where your nation stands at a cursory glance.||It can also help to see what other nation's relationships towards each other are, as you may be able to use this to your advantage!

Diplomatic relations map.||You can choose between two views: Other nation's attitudes towards selected nation, and selected nation's attitude towards others.||The regions are coloured according to this context. Green means friendly and red is unfriendly.||This is useful to see where your nation stands at a cursory glance.||It can also help to see what other nation's relationships towards each other are, as you may be able to use this to your advantage!

Diplomatic relations map.||You can choose between two views: Other nation's attitudes towards selected nation, and selected nation's attitude towards others.||The regions are coloured according to this context. Green means friendly and red is unfriendly.||This is useful to see where your nation stands at a cursory glance.||It can also help to see what other nation's relationships towards each other are, as you may be able to use this to your advantage!

Diplomatic relations map.||You can choose between two views: Other nation's attitudes towards selected nation, and selected nation's attitude towards others.||The regions are coloured according to this context. Green means friendly and red is unfriendly.||This is useful to see where your nation stands at a cursory glance.||It can also help to see what other nation's relationships towards each other are, as you may be able to use this to your advantage!
Open negotiations||You need to have selected a nation before clicking this.||This will open up the diplomacy panel, which is where the real deals are made.

uientry.s:
local this = UIComponent(Address) local parent = UIComponent(this:Parent("diplomatic_relations"))
sort_columns = { }
function OnMouseLClickUp() parent:LuaCall( "SetDisplayedFaction", this:GetProperty( "Faction" ) ) end
function Initialise( name, attitude ) sort_columns = { name, attitude } end
function LessThan(c, column) -- If the sort column is equal to the rhs value then use column 0 (the name) local rhs_value = UIComponent(c):GlobalExists("sort_columns")[column+1] return (column ~= 0 and sort_columns[column+1] == rhs_value) and sort_columns[1] < UIComponent(c):GlobalExists("sort_columns")[1] or sort_columns[column+1] < rhs_value end
function OnMouseOn() if (this:CurrentState() == "A_normal") then this:SetState("A_roll") elseif (this:CurrentState() == "B_normal") then this:SetState("B_roll") end end
function OnMouseOff() if (this:CurrentState() == "A_roll") then this:SetState("A_normal") elseif (this:CurrentState() == "B_roll") then this:SetState("B_normal") end end
